nodes.bodyText: I am missing the main UserExtSource which is also in Candidate. You wouldn't be able to say which one is the main from the list which I am note sure is or isn't a problem. I would work with this RichUserExtSource as a separate UES like in the Candidate to prevent this problem.
Also, you will never get the correct object of a Candidate from the CandidateSync without this information.
The main userExtSource should be saved in a different field of the object. Without it, you can't say which one is the main one.
There could be more than 1 attribute after the login. You should parse all of them. So this code should probably work for length>1.

I am just wondering about a use case where we want to find users by some attribute from the main userExtSource. I think that the way the code is written now, it will be not possible. What do you think @metodej and @stavamichal ?
I am not sure where would I find the attributes for main ues... Could they be part of the subjectData like the member and user attributes?
At this moment there is no way how to set attributes for main extSource. It would probably need another iteration (other PR) to fix this specific problem. You can't fix it here.
I think this will work only for single value attributes. @stavamichal do we want to support also multivalue attributes?

@balcirakpeter Do we already have ues attribute with multi-value as logins? If yes, then we need to fix it too. Which means to change format for the multivalue attribute. For example we can use something like "|login,urn=value1;value2,urn2=value1|1" (at least if these characters are not in the login itself and they are not used for parsing the whole string yet).
If you will be changing this one, please after the change send me re-request for review. Thank you.
Yes, we have such ues attribute on eduTEAMS instances called additionalIdentifiers.
Ok, so I've updated extraction to support multivalue attributes and re-request your reviews.
In such a case please @metodej prepare this code to be able to process multi-value attributes. Don't need to use my suggestion.
RichUserExtSource is missing in hashCode counting and also in method equals.
Fixed.

This whole method should be refactored to smaller parts with better Javadoc. There should be info what is the expected format of additionalUserExtSource in the subject, which part is which and how it will be parsed.
Ok, I've splitted the method to smaller parts and added some comments and javadocs.

The name of this method is very similar to the one parsing attribute value from escaped string (from DB) to the object Attribute in Perun. I would change the name and add more info to the javadoc (because this method has just one purpose and can't be used for other).
Changed.
So the LoA part is optional right? Can we have it explicitly in the javadoc please?

You don't really need to check it here. If there are 3 parts, you can work with that as it was ok already. So just pass the array (or arraylist) of arguments inside of the method parseAdditionalUserExtSource and let it process (or throw an exception if anything is wrong).

This method should take care of parsing data needed for creating the UES. If any argument will be missing, you can throw an exception here. Then you can catch it outside and just log it and skip the whole process (as before). What do you think? Create a new exception if needed or use standard ParseException.
You can throw the part with attributes here and then take care of parsing and everything else (same as in the method above).
